Reviews.Title: Sounded like a good idea ...
Reviews.Author: Ursiform
Reviews.Content: A camera well under a hundred bucks with a 28 mm (35 mm equivalent) wide angle lens? This is rare in cheap cameras,* but you do give up on the telephoto end, going only to 140 mm (35 mm equivalent). So this is a niche camera, but one that would be good for gatherings and party use, where you struggle to get everyone in the picture. It also has the feature that it runs on AA batteries, so you don't have to be tied to a charger; there is good and bad here, as I discuss below.First, to be clear, this is a cheap camera. Very plastic, very few features. This is a snapshot camera for someone who's happy with basic snapshots. And, no, GE doesn't make cameras. As is the case with most consumer products, GE has sold their name and logo to low-end producers. The GE logo on it doesn't signal quality.I used to like cameras that ran on AAs because I could use standard rechargeable batteries, with the backup of disposable batteries in a pinch. That's what I expected to do with this camera. No go. I tried six sets of NiMH batteries, four of those sets freshly charged. In every case it either wouldn't turn on, or turned on with a warning that the batteries were discharged. It appears to be built specifically to run on alkaline batteries, and can't handle the slightly lower voltage of rechargeables. That means you'll be paying for disposable batteries with this camera. And because alkaline batteries drop in voltage as they are used, they probably won't last as long in this camera as in a camera that can operate at a slightly lower voltage.While it does take fairly wide angle pictures, it has severe barrel distortion at the widest end. (In other words, if you take a picture of a rectangle the sides will appear to bulge out in the picture, making it look barrel-shaped.) Some barrel distortion is to be expected, but this camera has it pretty bad. (Not surprising, I suppose, given the low price point.) It may not be too noticeable in snapshots of people, but will be obvious if your scene has straight lines in it.The flash is weak, and even close shots can be underexposed. You can expect marginal performance to ten or twelve feet. The macro is spotty. I got some sharp shots, but in other cases I watched on the screen as the camera went through good focus to out of focus, then took the picture. Outdoor results are fine for snapshots; I wouldn't expect that buyers of this camera would be expecting to make enlargements, which is probably a good thing.If you need a camera at this price and you want to have a fair wide angle capability, this camera may be good enough for you. If you can go to about twice the price you can do a lot better, and you'll be saving the cost of all those disposable batteries.* The sensor chips in digital cameras are more sensitive to the angle the light comes in than is film. That makes wide angle lenses challenging for digital cameras. So cheap ones generally don't go very wide.

Reviews.Title: Good functions for a low-budget camera
Reviews.Author: Layna
Reviews.Content: My Sony DSC-P100 5.1 MP camera is from 2004 Sony Cybershot DSCP100 5.1MP Digital Camera with 3x Optical Zoom. It does video, came with a rechargeable cord for the lithium battery & a proprietary jack to connect with the tv. It used the long style memory  stick up to 1G. It is compact, looks good, but very complicated to use except for basic functions. It has a 1.8" lcd screen, but a Carl Zeiss lens.ComparisonStyle/Quality in buildThis GE camera looks barely better then something a parent gives a pre-teen, it looks very cheap with plastic housing.BatteriesIt uses AA batteries (I was able to use Eneloop hybrid NiMh which are great) which is better then a lithium battery that you are stuck recharging at inconvenient times that will one day not hold a charge & then you're stuck tossing the whole device.)MemoryThis camera uses a regular SD card which is more popular then a memory stick, so it wins. Can even use a microSD with a SD adapter/housing.Start-up timeSony still wins by 1/4 of a second, though not enough to matter.Color/ClarityThe Sony runs towards the reds a little, but the GE runs to the greens. The GE wins with it's 14MP over 5MP though on photos it's not as obvious, you actually have to look a bit. On video, the GE wins much better on HD vs. 640 video. There still seems to be a bit of noise on the GE there isn't on the Sony when video was taking within moments of each other.Extra features:The GE wins with stabilization, blink, smile detection, though they both have red eye reduction. But in order to use those extra features on the GE, you have turn them on each time. The smile detection did not work though with me on non-bright lamp lighting.LCD screenGE wins on size hands-down on size, though the display is very dull & low resolution like a cheap, older no-frills VGA cell phone display. I immediately had to put it on 100% to not make it look horrendous. It does have a wallpaper & start-up photos that you can choose other then the default.Ease of UseGE wins hands-down.Dedicated buttons: power, video & big one for pic taking on top.Next to LCD screen - W/T, Mode, Menu (settings) & play (see past pics/play past videos). It has a square buttons function/ok on the middle & macro on/off on the left, flash on the right, Disp on top & delete/timer on the bottom.Going deeper, the Flash has on, off, red-eye & slow synchro, slow synchro, red eye, auto.Timer: Off, 2 & 10 secondsModes:Panorama mode - no stitching, helps to make it easier.Scene Mode - shows pics & explains when to use it.  Landscapes, fast moving, beach, sunset, fireworks, night landscape, night portrait, party, children (flash disabled), indoor, snow, ID (size pics), museum (flash free, reduced blur), photo frame (add frame effects), panning shot (emphasizes motion of subject), Text, Leaf (plants), Glass (objects behind glass), Fish eye (creates effect), Sketch (adds pencil effect).Stabiliation mode - you have to turn this on every time.PortraitMovieIn Manual Mode You can choose:Megapixels - 14, 12 (3:2) 10 (16:9), 8, 5, 3 & 0.3Quality - best, fine, normalWhite Balance - Auto, Daylight, cloudy, Fluorescent, Florescent CWF, Incandescent, & press shutter to set white balance.Color - Auto, vivid (didn't see a difference on the LCD screen between the two), B&W; (saw the change & Sepia (saw the diff)ISO - Auto, 64, 100, 200, 400, 800, 1600EV - has a lines left to rightFlashThe light doesn't go far at all, overly bright close up, but after 4 ft, it drops off the cliff. The Sony you can change the level of flash, but on the GE you cannot.

Reviews.Title: Good entry-level camera
Reviews.Author: xkydivr
Reviews.Content: This 14mp, 5X zoom digital camera is from the GE smart series. It has many features of more expensive cameras: blink and smile detection, red-eye removal,HD video, image stabilization , 2.7 screen. I LOVE the "pancapture"for panorama views. You snap one picture, swing the camera until the square and circle line up and the camera does the rest. No complicated "stitching".You will need a flash card. I find the 8Gig ,6 class adequate.What is in the box? camera, USB cord, two AA batteries, wrist strap and quick-start instructions. You can go to the internet for more advanced instructions or, if you don't have internet, there is a contact address on your warranty card for a free instruction manual.In my opinion this is a well made, basic, easy to use, entry-level camera at a reasonable price. One year warranty. Made in China but isn't almost everything these days?I'm no expert but so far I haven't been able to find anything negative about the camera. If anything comes up after a few weeks use I will be back to update the review.***update: I haven't found anything negative about this camera. No, it's not a Leica or $300 Sony so don't expect it to feel or act like one. If you dream of a job with NATGEO or as top salesman in the best Buy camera department you might want to go a little more high tech. I think the camera is a good "starter camera" or for someone whose only interest in photography is taking pictures of the grand-kids, graduations, family gatherings. (you can get the whole bunch in with the panorama feature) The AA batteries are easy to find and cheap, especially in bulk or on holiday specials.

Reviews.Title: Nices Pictures for an Inexpensive Camera
Reviews.Author: Theresa M. Studer "Terra57"
Reviews.Content: Okay to be honest this is a cheaper looking camera but it does indeed have some really nice features.  I have posted four pictures that I took with it and you can see how wonderful it picks out the colors without washing them out.  Here are a few things I really like about this;  1. It takes double A batteries which is nice especially when you tend to forget to charge a rechargable battery.  2. It has a number of different settings for taking photos so if you don't like one then just try another.  3. I like the USB slot better on this one that the camera's more expensive model.  Just wish there was a cover of the the slot.  4. The colors are wonderous without washing them out.  Even the blues and reds seem to be better.  5. The size is comfortable and not awkward.  Perfect size for pocket or purse.  6. Directions help make it easy to use.A few things I'm not so sure about;  1. Not sure about how long the battery life is or would be if using it for an extended period of time.  2. There was a little hestitation in opening the shutter and I'm not sure if it is because the batteries just aren't strong enough or it might be a malfunction.  3. Wish there was a cover over the USB slot so you won't have to worry about it getting all ickied up with lint and dust or what not.Overall, the camera is a good bargin for someone just starting out or for someone that doesn't have the $$$$ to spend on a higher end model.  It's nice that the company has made a camera for real people that has decent functions, size and affordability.

Reviews.Title: Decent Budget Camera Plus HD Video and Wide Angle
Reviews.Author: Tech Lover
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera for family pictures.  It has a few features you would expect to find on more expensive cameras wike wide-angle, photostitch and image stabilization.  Uses convenient AA batteries and SD/SDHC memory. Big LCD but it washes out in daylight. No SD card and has only 50MB of built in memory.Pros* 14.1 Megapixels (2.3" CCD)* 5X optical zoom* SD Card / SDHC Card (Up to 32t)* Image Stabilization* Autofocus (face detection)* 720P movie @ 640×480 pixels: 30 fps / 15 fps* Red Eye Removal* Shooting Modes: Auto, Image Stabilization, Scene (Sport, Children, Indoor, Leaf, Snow, Sunset, Fireworks, Glass, Museum, Landscape, Night Landscape, Night Portrait, Beach, Text, Party, ID, Fisheye, Panning shot, Photo frame, Sketch), Portrait, Panorama Stitching, Movie2.7" LCD* USB2.0 & mini /AV-OUT* Used 2AA Batteries* Feels solidCons* Brand* Warranty* Nighttime Performance* Mono Audio (it's a camera)* No HDR* LCD Hard to see in daylight* No SD card, only 50MB internal storage.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Tabbyann Mcfarlane "Book worm"
Reviews.Content: This product was Camera from Circuit City via Amazon. I am very surprise at how cheap this camera is and the things it can accomplish! I also used my rechargeable batteries in this camera and it worked. This camera have a lot of cool features, and not to mention you can listen to the videos you make instead of waiting to connect the camera to the computer. My Youtube videos are going to be better starting today! :) I love love that it is 14.1MP. The pictures are clear and I can't wait to take pictures this Christmas! Any question feel free to leave a comment below.Oh and it was quickly shipped and arrived on time! Yeah :)

Reviews.Title: A great buy, with an amazing feature set for the price
Reviews.Author: M. Morim
Reviews.Content: The GE Smart camera may not be the best camera you've ever gotten but for it's price, it cannot be beat.A 14 megapixel 5x zoom accompanied with a fairly good 2.7" lcd screen is really hard to find for under $100, or even $150 if you go for a cannon or nikon.How does it compare then?Optics:in terms of optics, there's much to be desired, the photos could stand to be sharper and the focus could stand to be more accurate, but this issue plagues the $150 cameras as well.Features:this camera has a lot of them, mostly gimmicky, such as the "face detection" which works but for the most part just makes it harder to take photos and "smile detection" which is just plain silly. It does however have a few great features: the panorama assist feature works wonderfully as well as the adjustments for auto-scene which makes this camera perfect for non-photographers.Build Quality:the camera is actually built pretty well, don't expect a pro-like look, but the plastic pieces seem sturdy and the camera feels nice in the hand.Taking Photos:the camera has a considerable shutter lag which is to be expected from this level of camera, it could be quite annoying for a photographer that wants to take a few photos consecutively.Videos:The camera takes 720p video which is actually quite good!Conclusion:this is a perfect camera in the perfect price spot to buy for grandma and grandpa, or for the grandsons.it's also a pretty good choice for someone who wants to get a good camera with a lot of features for a good price and is not going to make an art exhibit with his photos anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: I like it...
Reviews.Author: Jill Tompkins
Reviews.Content: OK- So first of all, I do have the red 14mp version in a box sitting under my Christmas tree, but have yet to use it. But there's a reason I bought it... I have the 10mp version. It's almost exactly the same camera. Even at the lower resolution, I LOVE mine. THIS IS NOT AN ARTSY CAMERA. Some of these reviews are so much more technical than I know what to do with! If you're looking for a camera to take pictures of holidays and celebrations and vacations and family, THIS IS A GREAT CAMERA! It takes clean, clear pictures. I've had my 10mp version for 2 years w/ no problems. And it doesn't eat batteries as some would have you believe. They last a good while. The 14mp is a Christmas present for my stepdaughter. I bought GE on purpose because after terrible luck w/ a Sanyo that lasted 3 months, my GE has been RELIABLE. Again... if you want to take close ups of the dew on a flower petal by morning's first light, and know what a filter is, or have a collection of lenses; this is not for you. If you want a digital camera because film is expensive and you want 3x5's or 4x6's for albums and scrapbooks, this is awesome!

Reviews.Title: Cheap and useful
Reviews.Author: CF
Reviews.Content: Does it's job; don't expect any advanced feature on this camera; nor that it will make your evening or low light pictures to look like a pro with a DSLR.I use it mainly during the day for outdoor shots, works indoor too with the flash, but the ISO level is pretty bad, and same for the noise on the pictures, so avoid to take pictures inside unless you have a strong light source.The functions are easy to use, overall can't complain if you need a workhorse that replace your phone camera, but it does not even get close to better point and click devices (like Panasonic, Sony and such). Good for teens and people who needs something cheap and easy to use

Reviews.Title: Good Solid Camera; Great for the Price
Reviews.Author: Dennis Meek
Reviews.Content: If you need a good camera and you don't have phone that takes good photos and/or don't want to break the bank the GE Smart A1456W is a nice solution.Pro's-Good battery life-14MP-The optical zoom was better than I expected-Files transfer easy-Very nice screen size-Display screen has a grid function to help with lining up the shot-Print size setting is a plus and allows you to predetermine the size of print you want to automatically adjust the lens-Continuous shot function-Smile detection - awesome for kids that won't smile-Great flash-Great price for what you get-Video functionCon's-The instruction are virtually useless-No SD is included with the camera and the package does not tell you how much internal memory is available

Reviews.Title: A good Point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my wife, who liked to have a small straight-forward point & shoot camera.I did not expect it to be so good, especially when you consider that GE is not a big name in optic industry.It's anyway a good amateur camera, with lots of features, from smile, and face detection to red eye removal, electronic stabilization, panorama, burst shuts, etc. 14MP produces enough quality for your prints, and X5 optical zoom is sufficient for simple photography, like family pictures, etc.If you're looking for a small, simple, but still well-featured camera for an amateur photographer, it's a good choice.

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth5198
Reviews.Content: This camera has complex and great features and great clarity. If you want to spend hundreds of dollars you could get a camera just as amazing but why bother? This camera takes AA batteries and runs for days. You must purchase a memory card with it to have more than 5 pics on it. This camera has 14 mp. 14!!! Thats incredible!!! Especially for the price! I did lots of research on 14 mp cameras with these features this is the cheapest but its also the best working. I have had mine for 2 months and it is just wonderful. You may have doubts about it before buying but once you do there is nothing to say but awesome! I have had no problems but will definitly write another review if I do. The GE brand may be questionable for you for a camera. I thought that too since I have only seen their appliances but they do know how to make cameras! Also the zoom is awesome it zooms pretty far and you think thats as far as it goes and then keep pressing and it extends even farther! Great camera! Hope this review helps!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: dave
Reviews.Content: great camera for the money.if you need a camera for general use that you do not have to worry about this is it

Reviews.Title: GE Smart Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Basil MacDougal
Reviews.Content: My nine year old son has been wanting a camera.  Well, he's a little too old for one of those Buzz Lightyear cameras that look fun but function poorly.  And, they are almost as much as a camera such as this GE Smart.  So, I struggled for awhile as to what I should get him.  I was so delighted to be able to get the GE Smart.  I gave it to him, and he has thoroughly enjoyed it!  It's not such an expensive, high tech, piece of equipment that I have to worry about him caring for it or being able to figure it out.I love the fact that it uses AA batteries.  People seem divided on this subject.  Some like the rechargables.  I, personally, like the freedom of disposable AA batteries.  If we're out of town, on a trip, it is so easy to pick up a few extra batteries just about anywhere.  I like to use the Energizer Ultimate L91BP-4 Lithium AA Battery 4 Pack .  They last quite a long time.One word of warning, and this is a pet-peeve of mine, they did not include a memory card.  Most cameras don't come with one, which I understand, keeps the costs down, but is actually deceiving to the buyer.  So, you'll have to pick one of those up as well, Transcend 16 GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card TS16GSDHC10E.

Reviews.Title: Poor focus
Reviews.Author: John Horrocks
Reviews.Content: About one in three pictures is in focus. I have reset the AF and it is no better. This may be why this camera was returned. DiscountsJungle sent me a used camera as new. There are wear marks all over the camera, absolutely no doubt that it's a used camera. Don't buy from DiscountsJungle. They want me to send it back on my dime. I shouldn't have to pay for shipping when they send me a used item as new.

Reviews.Title: Not bad
Reviews.Author: Maxo
Reviews.Content: Camera definitely needs software update, to find the difference for  regular batteries and Ni-MH accu's voltages. It stops working for  rechargeable batteries when voltage falls to 1.25 V that is normal voltage for such type of battery.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: nethop
Reviews.Content: This is a really good inexpensive camera.  If you are looking for somethingto just take general pictures outdoors this will work well for you.Indoors however it does not do very well.  It does have a small zoom lens thatis easy to use.  It also runs off 2 AA batteries.  That can be a good or bad thing.It does not hold very many pictures on its own so you will need to purchase anSD card.  But the outdoor pictures turn out very well!  Clear with vivid color.I really like this camera for just general fun photography.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: repaso "camzam"
Reviews.Content: I was able to get a great deal on this camera. It works very well and I am impressed at the pictures it produces.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Cody Bowen
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome for the price that i paid for it, has great pictures and its easy to use. it does have some small set backs though, things like not being able to use the flash when in stabilizing mode, just small things like that.

Reviews.Title: a perfect simple camera
Reviews.Author: ForeverSPb "ForeverSPb"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son's 7th birthday. He loves it. Battery life is long. Use is simple, and picture quality is on par with my own Nicon Coolpix. It does need a memory card though.We have been using the camera for two months now, and it keeps working perfectly fine despite its low price (bought it here on sale for 69.99) and strange brand. Who thought GE can make good cameras.The only drawback is you can not pick its movie resolution - it only takes hi-def, and they take too much space. Still I gave it five stars because we all love it.

Reviews.Title: great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Milton Smith
Reviews.Content: I know GE is getting out of the camera business, the reviews I looked at on Amazon.com stated it was a good camera overall and I agree, the only thing I have a compliant about is battery life. But that was mentioned in the review I read, my solution by rechargable batteries NiMH 2300mAh, problem solved since I already have a battery charger.

Reviews.Title: Not a Bad Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Christopher Deweese
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big fan of GE products, but this little point and shoot gets the job done pretty well considering the price.  The LCD screen is fairly small and isn't all that clear, but the actual photos look really good when viewed on a computer screen.  Also, the video recorder works very well with excellent sound.  I think for the money, you are getting a pretty good little camera.

Reviews.Title: Great for Price
Reviews.Author: Marina Williams "marina"
Reviews.Content: Clear, clean pictures. the person i bought it for loves it!  one should purchase a memory card for it though.one con: it does not come with rechargable batteries or a charger. these must be purchased separately to avoid needing to tote spare batteries everywhere.

Reviews.Title: This was a Gift
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L. Clark
Reviews.Content: This camera was given as a gift.  So far it is working great.  I have an older model of the GE digital camera and just love the pictures it produces.  You can't beat it for the price.  My very expensive camera doesn't take pictures as will as this one.

Reviews.Title: Great Features, Great Price!
Reviews.Author: Grandma
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, I am pleasantly surprised.  My GE Smart A1456W-BK 14 MP with 5 x Optical Zoom Digital Camera, Black arrived yesterday and I've been having great fun with it.  Set up was so simple that even Granny (yes, I can build a computer but I still can't program the VCR LOL) managed to accomplish that in less than 3 minutes sitting in the parking lot at the mall - without the directions, since I didn't have my reading glasses.  I spent most of that time attaching the carry strap.The list of features is long.  Two that I checked out (still couldn't read the printed directions!) during that same parking-lot wait were the 5X Optical Zoom and the Face Detection.  Result:  a close-up picture taken from about the 10th parking spot out of three recognizable individuals walking out of WalMart. I could even make a fairly accurate list of what one woman had in her cart!  And while not tiny, the camera is small enough to fit in a pocket or a very small handbag.  Even better, the camera runs on two AA batteries (included) so you'll never need to haul around a charger.It is a gorgeous day here this morning, so I'm going out in a bit to grab some pictures of the last of the foliage and check out other features (maybe I'll see something worth taking a video of!), but do let me tell you about my latest discovery before I head out the door:  The camera uses the same USB cord that my cell-phone does!  While I do have a Mac, which claims to not "recognize the device", the pics were easily grabbed, and the quality was impressive.All in all, this is a nice, uncomplicated small point-and-shoot camera that would be perfect for a first camera at an extremely reasonable price (currently $79.99).  Give this one serious consideration for your holiday gifting.  The box is even small enough to fit into a stocking!If I have one complaint, it is that I wish my camera happened to be RED!  Highly Recommended!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: Tootsieroll
Reviews.Content: This little camera takes nice pictures BUT it doesn't have a card (the details does not tell you this) so if you don't set the pictures at the littlest size it doesn't hold very many. Details about the card should be included.
